publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1629 Ms Margo MacDonald: Scottish Executive Bonds—That the Parliament calls on the Scottish Executive, given the heavy and extended future financial burden already placed on its resources by Public/Private Partnership and PFI schemes, to investigate urgently the feasibility and possible advantages for future public spending programmes of the issue of Scottish Executive Bonds, fully guaranteed by Her Majesty's Government. Supported by: Alex Neil*
S1M-1629 Scottish Executive Bonds (lodged on 5 February 2001) Michael Matheson*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*
S1M-1629 Scottish Executive Bonds (lodged on 5 February 2001) Brian Adam*

S1M-1629 Ms Margo MacDonald: Scottish Executive Bonds—That the Parliament calls on the Scottish Executive given the heavy and extended future financial burden already placed on its resources by Public/Private Partnership and PFI schemes, to investigate urgently the feasibility and possible advantages for future public spending programmes of the issue of Scottish Executive Bonds, fully guaranteed by Her Majesty's Government. Supported by: Alex Neil, Michael Matheson, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Brian Adam, Shona Robison*
S1M-1629 Scottish Executive Bonds (lodged on 5 February 2001) Christine Grahame*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Mr Gil Paterson*, Donald Gorrie*
S1M-1629 Scottish Executive Bonds (lodged on 5 February 2001) Ms Sandra White*, Robin Harper*

S1M-1629 Ms Margo MacDonald: Scottish Executive Bonds—That the Parliament calls on the Scottish Executive, given the heavy and extended future financial burden already placed on its resources by Public/Private Partnership and PFI schemes, to investigate urgently the feasibility and possible advantages for future public spending programmes of the issue of Scottish Executive Bonds, fully guaranteed by Her Majesty's Government. Supported by: Alex Neil, Michael Matheson, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Brian Adam, Shona Robison, Christine Grahame, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Gil Paterson, Donald Gorrie, Ms Sandra White, Robin Harper

S1M-1629 Ms Margo MacDonald: Scottish Executive Bonds—That the Parliament calls on the Scottish Executive, given the heavy and extended future financial burden already placed on its resources by Public/Private Partnership and PFI schemes, to investigate urgently the feasibility and possible advantages for future public spending programmes of the issue of Scottish Executive Bonds, fully guaranteed by Her Majesty's Government. Supported by: Alex Neil, Michael Matheson, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Brian Adam, Shona Robison, Christine Grahame, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Gil Paterson, Donald Gorrie, Ms Sandra White, Robin Harper
S1M-1629 Scottish Executive Bonds (lodged on 5 February 2001) Mr Duncan Hamilton*

Supported by: Alex Neil, Michael Matheson, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Brian Adam, Shona Robison, Christine Grahame, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Gil Paterson, Donald Gorrie, Ms Sandra White, Robin Harper, Mr Duncan Hamilton
